data.title: Sarah (Hull) Fitch (1678-)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Sarah (Hull) Fitch born 1678  including ancestors + descendants + 1 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Born 27 Sep 1678 [location unknown]

Ancestors Descendants

Died [date unknown] [location unknown]

Profile last modified 3 Nov 2023 | Created 5 Jun 2012

This page has been accessed 623 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Family

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

4 Acknowledgements

Biography

Sarah Hull was born 27 September 1678, the daughter of Benjamin Hull and his wife, Rachel York.[1]

Sarah Hull married (1) in Piscataway, 4 February 1696/7, Benjamin Carle.[2] He died, probably Piscataway, New Jersey, before 20 January 1712[?/3] (she remarried). On 8 September 1713, administration on Benjamin Carle's estate was granted to Daniel and Sarah Fitch.[3]

Sarah Carle married (2) in Piscataway, 20 January 1712[?/3], Daniel Fitch.[4]

Family

Benjamin and Sarah (Hull) Carle are presumed the parents of several children, surname Carle, Corle or Curll, including,

Rosanna Carle, born Piscataway, 13 July 1698.[5]

John Carle, born Piscataway, 27 December 1700.[6]

(perhaps) Benjamin Carle. See Research Notes.

Daniel and Sarah (Hull) (Carle) Fitch were the parents of several children, including,

Daniel Fitch, born Piscataway, 7 November 1713.[7]

Joseph Fitch, born Piscataway, 6 April 1715.[8]

James Fitch, born Piscataway, 27 March 1717.[9]

Samuel Fitch, born Piscataway, 16 January 1719 (double dating not reported).[10]

Research Notes

1697 deed. Jeremy Andress, citing William Nelson, Patents and Deeds and Other Early Records of New Jersey 1664-1703 (Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co., 1982), 282,[11]

1697‐8 March 10. Confirmation to John Royse, Thomas Higgens, Edward Slater, John Drake, Edmund Dunham, John Smallie, Wm. Sutton, Thomas Sutten, Judah Sutten, Capt. Geo. Drake, Benjamin Corle, Justinian Hall, Benjamin Hull, Capt. Samuel Walker, Hugh Dun, John Molleson, Walter Robison, Joseph Rendolph, Charles Smallier, Isaac Smallie and Jedediah Higgens, all of Piscataway, for small tract of meadow there, on the Northside of Rariton R., West of the lower landing.

Son Benjamin? Various notices of Benjamin Corle appear in the New Jersey records. See especially the Fitch-johnson 1739 marriage bond record, as, below, in Patricia M. Bergener, "Early New Jersey Marriages-Extracts" (transcriptions), citing "microfilm copies of original marriage bonds in possession of NJ Dept. of Education, Division of State Library Archives & History, filmed in 1966," and FHL Catalog 0888701-0888710; web content, USGenWeb-NJ, via WayBackMachine.

#003; Samuel FITCH and Benjamin CORLE, both of New Brunswick in the County of Middlesex, yeomen... [bound to]... Lewis MORRIS, Governor... 500 pounds... 19 Jan MDCCXXXIX (1739). ... Samuel FITCH... obtained license of marriage for himself and for Jane JOHNSON of New Brunswick aboves'd, spinster... [w] Tho:s BARTOW.

Sources

↑ Charles H. Weygant, The Hull family in America ([?1913]), 254-255, for Capt. Benjamin (10) Hull entry; digital images, Internet Archive (accessed 2014).

↑ Carle-Hull 1696/7 marriage, Louis Lincoln Drake, "Piscataway, New Jersey, Marriage and Death Records : from the town records, 1668-1805" in Proceedings of the New Jersey Historical Society, new series, multiple vols., 4 (1919):33-43 at 34; digital images, Hathi Trust.

↑ William Nelson, ed., Calendar of New Jersey Wills, vol. 1 (1670‐1730) in Documents relating to the Colonial History of the State of New Jersey 23:109, entry dtd 8 Sept 1713 for Benjamin Corle, citing Lib. 1, p. 430; digital images, Archive.org (http://www.archive.org : accessed 15 Jan 2009); reads only, “Administration on the estate of granted to Daniel Fetch and wife Sarah.”

↑ Curell (?Carle)-Fitch 1712[?/3] marriage, Louis Lincoln Drake, "Piscataway, New Jersey, Marriage and Death Records : from the town records, 1668-1805" in Proceedings of the New Jersey Historical Society, new series, multiple vols., 4 (1919):33-43 at 34; digital images, Hathi Trust.

↑ Rosanna Carle or Curll 1698 birth, William A. Whitehead, "Piscataway Register of Births" in Proceedings of the New Jersey Historical Society, 3rd series, 2 (1897):73-80 (part 1) at 74 (Carle [or Curll]); digital images, FamilySearch, FHL film 1206443 (Item [4]), Digital Collection DGS 9049047, image 323 of 3372; parents as Benj, and Sarah Carle (or Curll, per footnote).

↑ John Carle or Curll 1700 birth, William A. Whitehead, "Piscataway Register of Births" in Proceedings of the New Jersey Historical Society, 3rd series, 2 (1897):73-80 (part 1) at 74 (Carle [or Curll]); digital images, FamilySearch, FHL film 1206443 (Item [4]), Digital Collection DGS 9049047, image 323 of 3372; parents as Benj, and Sarah Carle (or Curll, per footnote).

↑ Daniel Fitch 1713 birth, "Piscataway Births," (part 2 of the series) at 3rd series, 2 (1897):169-176 at 169-170; images 370-371 of 3372.

↑ Daniel, Joseph, James and Samuel, 1713-1718, children of Daniel and Sarah Fitch, see "Piscataway Births," (part 2 of the series) at 3rd series, 2 (1897):169-176 at 169-170; images 370-371 of 3372.

↑ Daniel, Joseph, James and Samuel, 1713-1718, children of Daniel and Sarah Fitch, see "Piscataway Births," (part 2 of the series) at 3rd series, 2 (1897):169-176 at 169-170; images 370-371 of 3372.

↑ Daniel, Joseph, James and Samuel, 1713-1718, children of Daniel and Sarah Fitch, see "Piscataway Births," (part 2 of the series) at 3rd series, 2 (1897):169-176 at 169-170; images 370-371 of 3372.

↑ Jeremy Andress, "Benjamin Hull, 1639-1713, NJ Records," Hull Surname Forum message post of October 24, 2002; web content, GenForum, for various transcribed entries, citing William Nelson, Patents and Deeds and Other Early Records of New Jersey 1664-1703 (Baltimore: Genealogical Publishing Co., 1982), p. 36, 42, 60, 63, 113, 120, 126, 137, 140, 167, 194, 198, 202, 220, 233. 237. 240, 242, 266, 273, 277, 282, 299, 310, 331 and 333.

See also--

Sybil Noyes, Charles Thornton Libby and Water Goodwin Davis, Genealogical Dictionary of Maine and New Hampshire, in 5 parts, paginated consecutively (The Southward Press, Portland, Maine, Southworth Press, 1928-1938), in particular

Philip "Teag" Cartee; 2:130 (Philip Cartee; Exeter); digital images, FamilySearch Books, especially for Philip Cartee married, 23 September 1668, Elizabeth York.

Salathiel Denbo; 2:192 (1-Salathiel Denbo, born about 1642); digital images, FamilySearch Books, saying his wife may have been a ______ Roberts; she married (2) William Graves. Authors refer to "Ancestry of Lydia Harmon, Davis, 1924, pp. 26-28."

John Gilman; 3:264 (10-John Gilman, son of 4-Edward Gilman); digital images, FamilySearch Books, especially for his age, 27 and "Jr." in 1677, married 31 May 1675, Grace York, daughter of Richard; her sister married Philip Cartee.

William Graves; 3:283 (6-William Graves, aged about 60 in August 1685); digital images, FamilySearch Books, especially for his first marriage, before October 1680, to Elizabeth, the widow of Richard York; Graves married (2) the widow of Salanthiel Denbo.

Capt. Benjamin Hull; 3:357 (1-Capt. Benjamin Hull; Oyster River, Dover); digital images, FamilySearch Books, especially for marriage, about 1668, Rachel York, daughter of Richard; saying five of Benjamin's eleven children appear born in New Hampshire; all married in New Jersey, "save 3 d. y." Included in his children is daughter, born 27 September 1678, Sarah Hull.

Rev. Joseph Hull; 3:357-358 (6-Rev. Joseph Hull; York, Oyster River, Isles of Shoals); digital images, FamilySearch Books.

Richard York; 5:775 (3-Richard York; Dover); digital images, FamilySearch Books, especially for his daughters, Elizabeth York married 1668, Philip Cartee, and Rachel York married 1-Benjamin Hull. Richard's daughter Grace York, not yet 18 in 1672, married 10-John Gilman.

The FORMAN Family Name Index Book ([URL p. 033]), compiled by Robert Forman and Phoebe-Jane Garland, inherited by Lundie Pinner, Robert's granddaughter.

Acknowledgements

WikiTree profile Hull-1303 created through the import of a GEDCOM file on Jun 4, 2012 by Lundie Pinner.
